comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Lieutenant (later Colonel) Paul Albert Pierre Tarascon (8 December 1882 – 11 June 1977) was a World War I flying ace. Despite the handicap of an amputated foot, he was credited with twelve confirmed and ten probable victories in aerial combat. He also served in World War II. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paul_Tarascon
